page.title: 03LANDSCAPE
page.content: APPLEY Appley consists of a small number of houses and farms. At the centre of Appley is the Globe, a pub which can be quite busy, especially after a cricket match has been played or when skittles are in progress. A house that is now lived in used to be the local Primary School. Like most of the buildings in the area, it is of considerable age and is constructed of slate from a nearby quarry. Modern buildings of the present school are hidden from view. At Appley Court Farm they have recently sold all their herd of cows. Nearby is Frogs Farmhouse which is quite ancient and has a pretty thatched roof.
